bill_title: provide for a temporary reduction of the salaries of legislators and certain state officers and employees and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for a temporary reduction of the salaries of legislators and certain state officers and employees and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The provisions of § 2-4-2 notwithstanding, the salary of each member of the Legislature for the 2010 Legislative Session is reduced by five percent from six thousand dollars to five thousand seven hundred dollars. Salaries for members of the Legislature for the 2011 Legislative Session are as provided in § 2-4-2. Section 2. If a state officer or employee was paid more than eighty thousand dollars in wages in FY2010, that officer's or employee's salary for FY2011 shall be reduced as provided by this section. Any amount of salary paid to the officer or employee in excess of eighty thousand dollars in FY2010 shall be reduced by five percent in FY2011. Section 3. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval. 180 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.052 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
